info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:15PM EDT until April 6 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Fall Creek near Fortville.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Fall Creek near Fortville.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Fall Creek at the edge of SR 238 at gaging site near Fortville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM EDT Saturday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.5 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Sunday morning by around 715 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Hamilton, IN; Hancock, IN; Madison, IN; Marion, IN
